intro: Collinsia bartsiifolia var. typica, commonly known as the Sierra foothill bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodland or meadow habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy inflorescences in late spring. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
